ARTICLE.TITLE: India coronavirus cases cross 25-lakh mark after recording over 65,000 fresh cases in 24 hours
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Representational Image | Photo Credit: AP

Key Highlights As per the Health Ministry, 65,002 new cases and 996 deaths were reported in India in the last 24 hours The ICMR confirmed that 8,68,679 samples were tested yesterday for COVID-19

New Delhi: With the addition of more than 65,000 fresh cases in the last 24 hours, the total number of coronavirus or COVID-19 cases in the country breached the 25-lakh mark, confirmed the Health Ministry on Saturday.

Apart from the fresh cases, around 1,000 new deaths were also reported in the last 24 hours, taking the virus-related death toll in India to 49,036.

As per the latest bulletin of the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, 65,002 new cases and 996 deaths were reported in India yesterday.

Out of the total positive cases reported so far in the country, 18.08 lakh have been successfully cured while 6.68 lakh are active cases of COVID-19.

Maharashtra remains the worst-affected state with nearly 6 lakh confirmed cases of the deadly virus. More than 4 lakh cases have been treated, 1.5 lakh are currently active while 19,427 hace succumbed to the disease so far in the coastal state.

Meanwhile, the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) announced that 2,85,63,095 samples have been tested up to August 14 for COVID-19. Out of these, 8,68,679 samples were tested yesterday.
